text: Robert Schiller (November 8, 1918 – October 10, 2017) was an American writer. He worked with fellow producer / screenwriter Bob Weiskopf on many television series in the United States, including I Love Lucy (1955–1957) and All in the Family (1977–1979) on the CBS network. For his work, Schiller received an Emmy Award in 1971 and in 1978. Schiller died on October 10, 2017 at his home in Pacific Palisades, Los Angeles from congestive heart failure at the age of 98. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1918 births Category:2017 deaths Category:American television writers Category:Writers from San Francisco Category:Emmy Award winning actors Category:Deaths from congestive heart failure
title: Bob Schiller
